title: Alan Turing
summary: Alan Mathison Turing (/ˈtjʊərɪŋ/; 23 June 1912 – 7 June 1954) was an English mathematician, computer scientist, logician, cryptanalyst, philosopher and theoretical biologist. He was highly influential in the development of theoretical computer science.

quiz.question: What is Alan Turing's profession?
quiz.explanation: Alan Turing worked as a mathematician, computer scientist, and cryptanalyst.

quiz.question: Who is considered the father of theoretical computer science?
quiz.explanation: Alan Turing is widely regarded as the father of theoretical computer science.

quiz.question: What machine did Turing introduce?
quiz.explanation: The Turing Machine models general-purpose computation.

quiz.question: Which field did Turing NOT directly contribute to?
quiz.explanation: Astrophysics is not mentioned as one of his fields.

quiz.question: In which year was Alan Turing born?
